259876: Full Stack Software Engineer at Cameo (Los Angeles, CA)

Job Description

Full Stack Software Engineer

What's the most impressive thing you've ever built? Are you proud of it? Are you ready to feel that feeling every day working at Cameo? Perfect, you're exactly who we're looking for.

Cameo creates moments that inspire (www.cameo.com). We're the platform where you can get Vicki Gunvalson from the Real Housewives to wish your friend happy birthday or Dennis Rodman to congratulate your daughter on her high school basketball game.  

We're well-funded, we have an awesome team, a fun product & a great product-market fit.  We have all the benefits you'd expect from a rocketship startup. We also have some of the benefits you may not expect: health insurance, 401(k), access to resources of a top tech incubator, and opportunities to hang out with the Talent on Cameo.

About the role:

You will be helping us improve & scale the platform that connects fans and talent to create the perfect video shoutout.  You will also be helping with our website and mobile app as well!

As a full stack software engineer, you will be working across multiple technologies, our frontend (React/Redux site, React-Native app), as well as our backend (node.js) and database (mongoDB).  You will collaborate with our sales and data teams to make the talent experience fun and engaging, and help us deliver that perfect Cameo.

A few things about yourself:

  • You take pride in your work
  • You have a strong product sense
  • You enjoy working with fun people
  • You are a doer who is comfortable with ambiguity
  • You love javascript, and building + scaling web applications

Things we hope you'll bring to the table:

  • 1+ years experience with front-end javascript frameworks
  • 2+ years experience with back-end javascript (node.js, express, etc)
  • JS Testing (Jest, Enzyme, Appium, etc)
  • Familiarity with NoSQL databases (Mongo)
  • Experience building robust and performant REST APIs in javascript.
  • The secrets of webpack ;)
  • Experience scaling a website and/or a mobile app to millions of users
  • Related industry experience, particularly social media and/or video tech

Cameo is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive and welcoming environment for every person who walks through our doors. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Cameo celebrates and embraces diversity.

255088: UI Engineer II at BillingTree (Phoenix, AZ)

POSITION PURPOSE:


Culture, Culture, Culture! If you are the type of person that would like to be part of a technology revolution and can help make our company not suck to come to work, then BillingTree might be the place for you. We have a family-approach to building relationships with our people, and rock star awesome benefits. The ideal candidate for this position should be comfortable working in a dynamic, creative, and fast paced environment with a fun spirited culture.

BillingTree is enhancing its product portfolio with a high-performance distributed payments system that embodies service-oriented principles. To help us scale our business we are looking for an experienced software engineer who possesses a hunger to learn, innovate, and deliver breakthrough solutions.  


The successful candidate will be someone who thrives on taking care of things the right way the first time. Someone who loves working on a high-caliber team to deliver the next generation of solutions for our customers. We are seeking someone who has strong technical skills with a can-do attitude and a focus on delivering high quality software. Someone who loves working on Microsoft technologies & frameworks like SQL Server, ASP.NET, Entity Framework and WebAPI. Someone with a passion for an exceptional UI/UX experience, and who knows how to deliver it using modern frameworks and tools. We move at a fast pace and deliver software iteratively using AGILE best practices. When you say, "I'll take care of it" we know it'll be done well.

  


Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:


  • Must be able to work in fast paced environment.
  • Strong analytical capability. Able to lead individual efforts independently through collaboration with various team members and other teams within the organization.
  • Assist with data modeling, process flow analysis and definition and refinement of business processes
  • Assess performance, scalability, reliability and uptime for new environment and work with the team to setup POC environment etc.
  • Maintain code compliance for financial, audit and security requirements
  • Exposure to multiple, diverse technical configurations, technologies, and processing environments.
  • Ability to apply multiple technical solutions to business problems.
  • Ability to comprehend the functions and capabilities of new technologies quickly
  • Ability to translate business needs into technical implementation with code.
  • Adheres to all company policies, procedures and business ethics codes.
  • May be required to perform other related duties as assigned.
 

Minimum Qualifications: 


  • Minimum 2+ years experience working with HTML, JavaScript, CSS, responsive design and related web-development components and frameworks such as Aurelia or Angular
  • Minimum 2+ years .Net coding experience
  • SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Experience preferred
  • Experience with web services is required
  • Experience in SOA architecture and enterprise services implementation preferred
